title: Should Christians Believe The Dead Are Conscious? (Panel Discussion)
description:
This is a discussion between Christians regarding whether we will be conscious following death, but before the resurrection - think, "Is grandma awake and aware right now, when she died two years ago?" 

Steven Hafley: I‚Äôm a published author of ‚ÄúUntil Death Be Defeated,‚Äù which is about the intermediate state. I also have two more books in the works. I was airborne infantry in the Army for six years, a former snake breeder, and I‚Äôm an XRP enthusiast. I live in Indiana, I‚Äôm 41, and I‚Äôm single. I also have YouTube channel called The Curious Kairos where I discuss my book and eschatology in general.

Nathan Bozeman: My name is Nathan Bozeman, founder of The Epitome, which is an apologetics ministry geared primarily toward defending the reliability of the Gospels and the historicity of the resurrection of Jesus. The Epitome can be found on YouTube, and I go by Nathan Bozeman on X, formerly known as Twitter. I'm a full-time Christian radio host, so all of my apologetics work is done because it's a great passion of mine. I take an ecumenical approach to conversations within the boundaries of the faith because I believe it serves as a better witness to the world for Jesus when we can get along. My prayer is that everything I do serves to glorify Jesus out of an overwhelming gratitude for what He's done for me and that many would come to know Him through the work of The Epitome.

Chris Date: My calling‚Äîmy desire, my passion, my mission‚Äîis to serve Christians by helping to reform their hearts and minds and inviting their help to reform my own. To this end, In 2017 I graduated summa cum laude from Liberty University with a Bachelor of Science in Religion, concentrating on biblical and theological studies, and in 2020 I graduated with a 4.0 GPA from Fuller Theological Seminary, where I focused on exegesis of the Old Testament in its original Hebrew. I‚Äôm an adjunct professor of Bible and theology at Trinity College of the Bible and Theological Seminary, and I hope to teach full-time one day, once I can pursue a doctorate in Old Testament biblical studies. I‚Äôm a congregant and occasional preacher at Table of Hope Community Church in Puyallup, Washington, where I am being developed for eldership. I‚Äôm the public face of the ministry Rethinking Hell and the host of the Theopologetics YouTube show and podcast. I publish books and academic journal articles, speak at conferences, participate in debates, and minister whenever and wherever else the Lord gives me the opportunity. 
Chris' books: https://www.amazon.com/Christopher-M....
Chris' channel:    / @theopologetics   

James Harding: My name is James Harding; I'm 25 years old; I'm from Quebec, Canada; I'm a freelance translator (English to French or vice versa); I am the reigning, defending, undisputed champion of the world in... nothing; I run a very small YouTube channel called ‚ÄúStudy is Key‚Äù on which I unintentionally upload mostly response videos. Other times, I upload videos on whichever biblical topic or passage I find worthy or interesting enough to address; Lastly, since the very beginning of 2024, I've been a member of the Rethinking Hell ministry (thanks to Chris Date) and have published both 1) lengthy articles and 2) what I call ‚Äúcheat sheets,‚Äù which are one-page, point-by-point treatments of individual passages or terms relating to Hell that people can print out before going to talk with a friend, family member or pastor to help them offer good explanations.

Adam Terry: I‚Äôm Adam Terry and I run @curiouschristianity on YouTube and Substack. I am an aspiring author and self-proclaimed expert on Genesis 3:14-19. I am currently finishing a book on Genesis 3:16 titled It Was Never About Adam. I also champion Intertextual Hermeneutics as one of the best interpretive frameworks for the Bible and believe that there is a need to call Christians back to the Bible and its authority. I have done debates on many topics such as the intermediate state, annihilationism, Young Earth Creationism, and the Millennium. I have a passion for the Word of God but more importantly for the God of the Word. I hope to serve Christ‚Äôs church through my research, conversations, videos, and conduct of my life.

title: Professor Gives MASTERCLASS On AI Personhood | Dr. Jason McKinney
description:
The rise of artificial intelligence is a game changer for how we relate to technology. AI raises practical and ethical questions about our future-questions that are currently generating a great deal of anxiety and hope. But AI also raises deeper metaphysical questions about selfhood and humanity. What does it mean to be a person? What gives human life value? Are human beings truly unique? If so, how? Though these questions are increasingly unavoidable, most people are underprepared to answer them.
What is a Person in the age of AI? This is a topic that must be addressed head on. The implications are far-reaching and increasingly relevant. As we consider the reality of personhood, we come face-to-face with the most fundamental questions of life: who we are, and where we find meaning.

Dr. McKinney's Book: https://www.amazon.com/What-Person-Age-Jason-McKinney-ebook/dp/B0FKK4TVD7/ref=sr_1_1?crid=161DJCHCS0TOY&dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.hZfysUcxt47S2rPQTDWObA526JYmnc0RUN78l0VVEyW7tzNdmfs7cJgZj8fNQQvA.xkDBiO65b3osSKMB1ZTHnn6YG3R2Z2MnjvHmOCVWecc&dib_tag=se&keywords=jason+lee+mckinney&qid=1756994271&s=digital-text&sprefix=jason+lee+mckinney%2Cdigital-text%2C89&sr=1-1

I'm a full-time Christian radio host, so all of my apologetics work is done because it's a great passion of mine. I take an ecumenical approach to conversations within the boundaries of the faith because I believe it serves as a better witness to the world for Jesus when we can get along. My prayer is that everything I do serves to glorify Jesus out of an overwhelming gratitude for what He's done for me and that many would come to know Him through the work of The Epitome.

Chris Date: My calling‚Äîmy desire, my passion, my mission‚Äîis to serve Christians by helping to reform their hearts and minds and inviting their help to reform my own. To this end, In 2017 I graduated summa cum laude from Liberty University with a Bachelor of Science in Religion, concentrating on biblical and theological studies, and in 2020 I graduated with a 4.0 GPA from Fuller Theological Seminary, where I focused on exegesis of the Old Testament in its original Hebrew. I‚Äôm an adjunct professor of Bible and theology at Trinity College of the Bible and Theological Seminary, and I hope to teach full-time one day, once I can pursue a doctorate in Old Testament biblical studies. I‚Äôm a congregant and occasional preacher at Table of Hope Community Church in Puyallup, Washington, where I am being developed for eldership. I‚Äôm the public face of the ministry Rethinking Hell and the host of the Theopologetics YouTube show and podcast. I publish books and academic journal articles, speak at conferences, participate in debates, and minister whenever and wherever else the Lord gives me the opportunity. 
Chris' books: https://www.amazon.com/Christopher-M.-Date/e/B01MS4LBGA
Chris' channel: https://www.youtube.com/@UCnlagBRu-t-9_tX6NivDfXw 

James Harding: My name is James Harding; I'm 25 years old; I'm from Quebec, Canada; I'm a freelance translator (English to French or vice versa); I am the reigning, defending, undisputed champion of the world in... nothing; I run a very small YouTube channel called ‚ÄúStudy is Key‚Äù on which I unintentionally upload mostly response videos. Other times, I upload videos on whichever biblical topic or passage I find worthy or interesting enough to address; Lastly, since the very beginning of 2024, I've been a member of the Rethinking Hell ministry (thanks to Chris Date) and have published both 1) lengthy articles and 2) what I call ‚Äúcheat sheets,‚Äù which are one-page, point-by-point treatments of individual passages or terms relating to Hell that people can print out before going to talk with a friend, family member or pastor to help them offer good explanations.

About Dr. Kevin Lewis: Kevin Lewis has served as Professor of Theology and Law at Biola University.  He has degrees in Religious Studies (B.A., CSULB), Systematic & Historical Theology (M.Div. & Th.M., Talbot School of Theology), and Law (J.D., Whittier law School).  He taught at Biola University for two decades both in the Theology Department at Talbot School of Theology and in the M.A. Christian Apologetics Program, focusing on the fields of Polemical & Elenctic Theology, Systematic Theology, Christian Apologetics, Theology and Law integration, and Jurisprudence & Public Policy.  He is the Founder and President of the Institute for Theology & Law, a practicing attorney and a partner at the Law Office of Lewis & Lewis, and an affiliate attorney with the Pacific Justice Institute.  He is an active lecturer and seminar speaker at churches, colleges, and conferences and has appeared on many radio programs and television shows addressing a variety of theological, legal, political, and apologetics topics.

title: The BIBLE Case for WOMEN Pastors?!
description:
Nick Quient responds to key texts in the debate between complimentarians and egalitarians regarding women in ministry leadership. He holds the position that it is biblically permissible for women to serve in these areas. here's a bit more about Nick in his own words: 

I am presently serving as Pastor at First Baptist Church of Palos Verdes. Published researcher working in the intersection of New Testament studies and Christian Theology. Currently working through the PhD program at Ridley College in Melbourne, Australia to study in the subject of Pauline theology.

"I am an avid researcher who is involved in presenting complex academic subjects in my local church body as well as in academic publishing in numerous peer-reviewed journals. My MA at Fuller Theological Seminary was centered largely in New Testament Studies with courses on Greek exegesis of Philippians, Galatians, Ephesians, Colossians, and Philemon. I am relational, collaborative, and an independent researcher who is will take the initiative to learn and think critically about the text of Scripture and its implications for theology and life.

I am active in social media, podcasting and audio editing for numerous projects. I am ordained in the American Baptist Churches USA (ABCOFLASH region) and have served in pastoral ministry for over 3 years."

Nick's channel is: https://www.youtube.com/@NickQuient
Nick's book: https://www.amazon.com/stores/Nicholas-Rudolph-Quient/author/B082QRDLGY?ref=ap_rdr&isDramIntegrated=true&shoppingPortalEnabled=true

title: Mike Licona SPEAKS OUT After SHOCKING Allegations
description:
Norman Geisler, and JI Packer were involved in the crafting of what is known as the Chicago Statement on Biblical Inerrancy. Geisler thought that Licona‚Äôs views placed him outside of what is acceptable within the Chicago statement. JI Packer passed away in 2020, and he has often been cited as agreeing with Geisler about Licona‚Äôs work. Yet, it‚Äôs also been suggested that Packer actually agreed with Licona, and thought his work could be consistent with the Chicago statement. On the one hand, Packer endorsed Licona‚Äôs book on the gospels, on the other, Geisler says the following, ‚ÄúPacker insisted that he strongly stands by both his affirmation of the ICBI statements on inerrancy and that Licona‚Äôs views were categorically contrary to it.‚Äù

Recently, a critic of Dr. Licona (Dr. Bill Roach) has challenged Licona on his thoughts on Packer, as well as his understanding of the Chicago Statement, inerrancy, and inspiration. 

Now Licona, Dan Wallace, Paul Copan and others discuss what JI Packer actually said about these matters in their presence. 

PART ONE: https://youtu.be/x_A2waU3fFc?si=SnFbMbcgubt9TZc7

NOTES on Son of Man: "When we encounter a thoroughly consistent and distinctive feature - a tradition which depicts Jesus regularly using the phrase 'son of man' and virtually no other use of the phrase - it simply beggars scholarship to deny that this feature stemmed from a remembered speech usage of Jesus himself." James D.G. Dunn, taken from: Craig, William Lane. "Reasonable Faith" 3rd ed. (Wheaton, IL; Crossway Press), 315. "Son of Man" was Jesus' favorite honorific title for himself. It is used 80-83 times in the gospels, and only 3 or 4 times outside of the gospels in the New Testament. I (Braxton) said, "... I think, if I'm right, outside of the gospels this is only used one other time about Jesus..." So, modify that to only 3 or 4 and the point is still made to, literally, ALMOST exactly the same degree.

title: Is Argument for GOD Consistent with SCIENCE?
description:
Is Argument for GOD Consistent with SCIENCE?
In this video, the speaker discusses the cosmological argument and its relationship with science up to the point of the Big Bang. They clarify that they do not use science to argue for the Kalam cosmological argument, but rather 
approach it philosophically. The argument is seen as consistent with science until the beginning of nature, which is the focus of scientific study. Beyond that point, the discussion shifts to philosophy when considering existence without the physical universe. The speaker emphasizes the importance of philosophical considerations in understanding the concept of God in relation to the origins of the universe.

title: ATHEIST: If GOD Then No FREE WILL
description:
ATHEIST: If GOD Then No FREE WILL
The video discusses the reconciliation of belief in libertarian free will with belief in an omniscient God who knows the outcome of everyone he creates. The speaker explains that God's knowledge of the future does not cause individuals to act in a certain way, as knowledge is not causal. The concept of a modal fallacy is introduced to address the misconception that God's knowledge determines human actions. The discussion highlights the distinction between God's omniscience and human free will, emphasizing that one's actions are not predetermined by God's knowledge.

title: RHETT McLaughlin's Case AGAINST the Resurrection
description: Rhett discusses the challenges of uncovering the truth about the historical Jesus, as different people come to wildly different conclusions. Unlike science, history does not always lead to definitive answers. The most compelling view presented is that the Gospels contain a mix of religious propaganda and actual history. Braxton argues that a lack of certainty about the resurrection hypothesis, shouldn't count against it.

title: ATHEISTS have BETTER Answers?
description: The video discusses the lack of satisfying explanations for the origins of humanity, the universe, and the Earth without the need for a supernatural entity. The video suggests that there is a lack of engagement with arguments like the Kalam Cosmological Argument from this atheist (Christopher Hitchens), specifically. It emphasizes the need for a more thorough examination of these arguments rather than relying on the hope for future naturalistic explanations.

title: ATHEIST asks if DOG POO is Evidence of GOD
description: The video discusses a recent Big Bang breakthrough that has caused a stir in the science world, with CNN suggesting it could also support biblical beliefs. The speaker questions what counts as proof, using the example of their mom's dog defecating as a possible argument for God's existence. Braxton argues that the intelligent design seen in biological beings like dogs, and the systems within them that allow for necessary functions like defecation, could be evidence of a higher power. He challenges the idea that such occurrences cannot be considered as  existence of God.

title: Scripture Reveals URGENT Fact About Israel
description: Scholars and laymen do a deep dive into The Book of Romans.

title: ATHEIST Challenge: What About Spiritual Experiences in Other Religions?
description: In the video, the speaker discusses the concept of relationships between believers and their gods in various religions. They question why some people believe their relationship with Jesus Christ is special or unique compared to others' relationships with their gods. Braxton argues that there is evidence to support the truth of the Christian message, but not for the central claims of other religions.

title: ATHEIST CHALLENGE: Origin of the Universe
description: The video discusses how creationists often criticize secular cosmologies that involve a universe from nothing while simultaneously believing in a supernatural being creating the universe out of nothing. The argument is made that there must be a first cause for the universe, as things cannot cause themselves to come into existence within the categories of space, time, and matter. The debate revolves around the concept of a universe being created without a cause, leading to a discussion on the origins of the physical universe.

title: ATHEIST CHALLENGE: Doubting Thomas Was Right
description: The video discusses the story of doubting Thomas from the Bible and questions why he is often portrayed negatively for utilizing the scientific method to seek evidence. It highlights how God provided evidence to Thomas by showing him his wounds, indicating that God is willing to provide evidence to those who seek it. However, Thomas had already witnessed miracles performed by Jesus but still struggled to believe, making his doubt unique. The video challenges the perception of Thomas as the bad guy and raises questions about the importance of evidence in belief.

title: ATHEIST: God Gave Us BAD BRAINS
description: The video transcript questions the concept of religious condemnation for blasphemy, pointing out the existence of thousands of religions. It challenges the idea of a true God allowing humans to be easily deceived into believing in other religions, leading to condemnation. The speaker questions how one can be sure they are not one of the deceived individuals.

title: ATHEISTS Have ONE LESS God Than You Do!
description: An Atheist discusses the inconsistency in believing in one specific religion while rejecting all others, questioning the logic behind such beliefs. Braxton addresses the flaw in this reasoning and expresses confusion over how this argument has gained traction in atheist circles. The comparison is made to creationist arguments. Overall, the video challenges the idea of believing in a specific religion as the only correct one and questions the validity of such beliefs.

title: ATHEIST CHALLENGE: God Wants BLOOD Sacrifice?
description: The video questions the concept of an all-powerful God requiring a human sacrifice for forgiveness of sins. It challenges the idea that a loving and just God would need a brutal act like this instead of simply forgiving. It emphasizes the importance of considering both God's love and justice together to understand this concept without contradictions. The speaker raises thought-provoking questions about the necessity of blood sacrifice in relation to God's capabilities and intentions.

title: Is Christianity the Only Way? | Analysis of a Heated Discussion
description: Biblically, Jesus is the only way to salvation, as he is described as the way, the truth, and the life. This belief may be seen as offensive to followers of other religions, as it asserts that salvation can only be found through Jesus. Christians emphasize that they themselves cannot save others, but rather point to Jesus as the savior. The message is centered on the idea that Jesus is the only path to salvation, offering hope and redemption to those who believe in him. #vizard

title: The Rise of Satan Clubs in Public Schools | Braxton Hunter & Johnathan Pritchett
description: The video discusses a recent ruling in Pennsylvania where public schools are required to allow Satan clubs to operate. The speaker mentions that similar clubs are present in other states as well, with a push to have more in public schools. They caution against opposing such clubs, as it could inadvertently strengthen Christianity's presence in public spaces. The speaker suggests that allowing different worldviews to coexist can help strengthen the Christian perspective. Overall, the video emphasizes the importance of being strategic in addressing controversial issues in public schools. #vizard

title: The Truth About Obeying Governments vs. Submitting to Authority | Romans Explained
description: The video discusses the concept of submitting to government authority as stated in the Bible, using the example of early Christians who refused to sacrifice to Caesar but accepted the consequences. The speaker emphasizes the importance of following the gospel over man-made laws, such as Sharia law, especially when it conflicts with spreading the message of God. The message is to prioritize obedience to God's commands over human laws that contradict religious beliefs. #vizard

title: Are "Atheists" Atheists? Former Atheist's Account!
description: Top Christian scholar, Craig Keener, reflects on his past atheism. Even in a culture that leans towards atheism, the concept of design in nature is hard to ignore.

title: Boiling a Goat in its Mother's Milk
description: The video discusses the concept of boiling a goat in its mother's milk, which goes against the natural order of using milk to nourish and provide life. This act is seen as using something meant for good as a destructive force. The speaker speculates on the reversal of nature in this practice and how it may be reflected in other aspects of the law code. The discussion highlights the idea of using what is meant for life as a tool for harm, suggesting a deeper meaning or symbolism in this act. #exodus23:19, #oldtestament,

title: Unveiling the Ancient Idea of Intelligent Design | Exploring Nature's Design
description: The video discusses the concept of intelligent design, which was not exclusive to Christianity but also present in ancient Stoic philosophy and even in the Old Testament. The idea that nature must be designed is echoed by various thinkers throughout history, including Stoics who emphasized the presence of design in the natural world. This belief is also reflected in passages from the Psalms in the Old Testament. The video highlights the commonality of this idea across different cultures and time periods, challenging the notion that intelligent design is solely a Christian concept. #vizard

title: The Hiddenness of God: A Path to Sanctification
description: The speaker discusses the concept of God's hiddenness being beneficial for our sanctification, likening it to the process of shedding our sins to become true sons of God. They reference the hymn Come Thou Fount and the idea that one day we will see God's lovely face. The speaker also mentions how Jesus' first coming was misunderstood by many who either wanted to kill him or make him a king, highlighting the importance of going through the correct processes to truly understand and become closer to God. The overall message is that God's hiddenness serves a purpose in our spiritual growth and journey towards becoming the individuals we are meant to be. #inspiringphilosophy @InspiringPhilosophy

title: EXPERT Presents New Case for the SUPERNATURAL (W/ Dr. Joshua Farris)
description:
Dr. Joshua Farris, a celebrated academic with dozens of published articles, discusses the creation of the self, consciousness, artificial intelligence, and reasons that God is the best explanation for the soul. He lays it all out in his new book, ‚ÄúThe Creation of Self,‚Äù linked below. 

From the back cover of the book: 
Situated in broader science-and-religion discussions, The Creation of Self¬†is the first book-length defense of a creationist view of persons as souls. This book therefore serves as both a novel argument for God's creation of selves and as a critique of contemporary materialist and emergent-self alternatives, critically examining naturalistic views that argue for a regular, law-like process behind the emergence of personhood. Author Joshua Farris argues on the assumption that persons are fundamentally unique individuals that look more like singularities of nature, rather than material products grounded in regularity or predictability from past events. By extending the basic intuition that we are unique and mysterious individuals, Farris develops a sophisticated analytic defense of the soul that requires a sufficient explanation not found in nature but made by a Creator who has intentions and the power to bring about novel entities in the world. The Creation of Self¬†gives philosophers, theologians, and the lay intellectual grounding for thinking about persons as religious beings. It aims to help readers understand why recent scientifically motivated objections to the soul are unsuccessful, and why we must consider a religious conception of persons as souls as a common starting point.

Dr. Farris‚Äô New Book: https://www.amazon.com/Creation-Self-Case-Soul/dp/1803410868
Dr. Farris‚Äô Academia Page: https://rub.academia.edu/JoshuaFarris
Dr. Farris' Amazon Author Page: https://www.amazon.com/stores/author/B088KV4X2H/allbooks?ingress=0&visitId=aa5a5cce-a304-4293-9e67-aa88f41550f1&store_ref=ap_rdr&ref_=ap_rdr

title: Not 100% Sure About Christianity? Do this! - w/ @lizjackson111
description:
What if the evidence and arguments for Christianity still leave you uncertain. Dr. Liz Jackson joins me to discuss why it‚Äôs smart to wager that Christianity is true. This might be just what you need. 

Dr. Jackson‚Äôs Channel: https://www.youtube.com/@lizjackson111

Article on wager arguments from Dr. Jackson: https://philpapers.org/rec/JACPAF?fbclid=IwAR3z1snOriBgMLQO3g4O79QiDZLpdTzAtOG6KZ9OJ56VPiJnINKpbEUA1cU

Below is Dr. Jackson‚Äôs bio in her own words. 

I‚Äôm an Assistant Professor in the Department of Philosophy at Toronto Metropolitan University (formerly Ryerson University). Previously, I was a Research Fellow in the School of Philosophy at Australian National University.

I received my Ph.D. from the Department of Philosophy at the University of Notre Dame, and my BA in philosophy at Kansas State University.

My primary research is in epistemology, much of it falling at the intersection between formal and traditional epistemology. Recently, my research has focused on the relationship between belief and credence. I defend and explore implications of dualism about belief and credence. Dualism is the view that we have both beliefs and credences, and neither attitude is reducible to the other. My interests in epistemology also include (defending) epistemic permissivism, (arguing against) pragmatic and moral encroachment, and other issues in social epistemology (e.g. disagreement, epistemic paternalism).

My secondary research interests are in philosophy of mind, specifically the nature of belief, and philosophy of religion, specifically Pascal‚Äôs Wager and the nature of faith. I have further interest in decision theory, ethics and normativity, and metaphysics.

My non-philosophical interests include sports (especially basketball), traveling, avocados, coffee, weight lifting, cooking, and podcasts.

Dr. Liz Jackson: https://www.youtube.com/user/lizjackson111

Our Second Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoKBYjjPp7VtcaH3fewhznQ

title: Can Christians Reach Sinless Perfection Now?
description:
Some Christians believe that they can reach a point in their spiritual growth at which they begin to live above sin. Few of us have likley met those, in daily life, who would claim this about themselves. Nevertheless, Christians maintain a belief in the doctrine of sanctification, a process in which they seek to become more and more like Jesus. Surely, there are many who strike us as taking that process more seriously than others. Does this mean some people actually reach perfection? 

Nick Quient, in his own words: I am a husband, father, and a graduate of Fuller Theological Seminary (MA: New Testament) and Biola University (BA). I have published peer-reviewed material in The Canadian-American Theological Review, Priscilla Papers, and Evangelical Review of Theology. I am ordained in the American Baptist Churches USA (ABCOFLASH region) and am currently working (very slowly) on a PhD in New Testament at Ridley College in Melbourne, Australia.

Nick‚Äôs Channel: https://www.youtube.com/@NewTestamentTheologist/featured

title: You Were Never Really an Atheist #apologetics #deconversion #deconstruction #atheism #christianity
Why Top Apologist Might Use Molinism (+ I React to Atheist TikTok)
description:
A critic challenges a top apologist on how he approaches the text of scripture. William Lane Craig has long articulated and affirmed the view known as molinism, and he has employed it with respect to a variety of theological areas of interest. In reacting to the critic, I hope to provide a very basic explanation of what molinism is, and why I think it is appropriate for Dr. Craig to appeal to it in answering objections that arise regarding Pharaoh and his "hardened heart." I found the critic to be thoughtful, and his concerns understandable. So why do I still think Craig's approach is acceptable in a case like this? We'll talk about it on the show as well as discuss several atheist tiktoks!

title: Christians are wrong about holiday traditions - So What?
Wait, That's Why You Left Jesus?
description:
The reasons given by these TikTok creators for no longer affirming Christianity are THEIR reasons, whether we think they are GOOD ENOUGH reasons to reasonably conclude Christianity is false or not. It's important to point out where the intellectual problems reside in these objections, but these are human beings. They matter. While I hope to respond to what I consider problematic, Christians definitely need to recognize, from this, that sometimes unbelievers walk away for bad, but meaningful reasons. It may not be that these individuals provide what I consider to be intellectually powerful reasons to reject Christianity, but their reasons are still sometimes deeply personal. Christians may have the truth, but that doesn't mean we aren't often also unsympathetic, unkind or cruel. For this, WE should self-reflect.

title: Dr. Adam Harwood - Theology in a Time of Worldview Confusion
description:
What do Christians think about the spiritual destination of infants who pass away? What do believers think about the nature of God? Does God have a physical body or not? Is He timeless or not. Why do we use "He" when talking about God? What do they think of mankind? Do we Have free will, or not? Do we have souls, or not? What about angels, demons, hell, heaven, creation, or the nature of Christ? These questions are all covered in the realm of Systematic Theology. The guest in this video is a systematic theologian who has just published his new work on that subject. 

Adam Harwood serves as professor of theology at New Orleans Baptist Theological Seminary (occupying the McFarland Chair of Theology), director of the Baptist Center for Theology & Ministry, and editor of the Journal for Baptist Theology and Ministry. (Taken from NOBTS website)

Dr. Harwood's Systematic Theology: https://www.amazon.com/Christian-Theology-Biblical-Historical-Systematic/dp/1683596013/ref=sr_1_1?qid=1665157690&refinements=p_27%3AAdam+Harwood&s=books&sr=1-1
Dr. Harwood's Book on The Spiritual Condition of Infants: https://www.amazon.com/Spiritual-Condition-Infants-Biblical-Historical-Systematic/dp/1608998444/ref=sr_1_3?qid=1665157793&refinements=p_27%3AAdam+Harwood&s=books&sr=1-3&text=Adam+Harwood

title: @Soteriology101: God's Knowledge Doesn't Result in Determinism
description:
Atheists and Calvinists often find the notion that God knows what one will do with certainty (and He cannot be wrong), to be incompatible with the sort of free will non-Calvinist Christians affirm. If God knows what I will certainly do, then do I really have a choice? In this short video, we'll break it down. 

Special Thanks to Leighton Flowers of @Soteriology101

title: When Division is Necessary
description:
Cries for unity are common among evangelicals. "Who cares what it says on the sign, as long as you love Jesus," say many who long for a church without unnecessary divisions that can sometimes cause such pain within the body of Christ. Amen! But, while it is tragic to see a lack of unity where it should be had, it is certainly tragic to pretend theological unity where it cannot exist. How should Christians think about this? Jude will help us with that answer. 

From the speaker: 

I AM THE SUM OF MY PARTS . . . 

God has moved in my life through a number of powerful men and women of God from whom I have benefited greatly. There is nothing new under the sun, as it is said. For that reason, much of what you hear in these lectures is not unique to me. Most of it was likely gleaned from other sources. I want to be transparent about that and share my sources. In terms of biblical scholarship, I have been blessed by the work of Harold Hunter (my father), Craig Keener, David Allen, Malcom Yarnell, Tom Schriner, Johnathan Pritchett (with whom I co-host Trinity Radio), F.F. Bruce, Adam Harwood (with whom I have co-authored), Steve Gregg (with whom I have worked), and Bruce Ware.

As for Christian apologetics, William Lane Craig (with whom I have lectured), Michael Licona (a personal friend), Gary Habermas, Norman Geisler, J.P. Moreland, William Dembski, Michael J. Murray, James White, Alvin Plantinga, and a host of others have impacted my thinking.

Because I have been so impressed with the structure, organization, and delivery of his own audio commentary, I personally made request to Steve Gregg (who has served as a visiting professor for Trinity) that I might follow his model. In fact, he was delighted with the idea that I might largely follow his teaching outline.

Why then, with so much great scholarship already available, would I want to add my voice? There are three reasons. First, I can imagine no more worthy endeavor than to study and proclaim the truths of scripture. Second, though I admire greatly the men listed above, I do not agree with any of them on all things. Third, God has blessed me with a humble audience that does not listen to these other voices.

I hope that you will benefit from this passing on of knowledge.

From the speaker: 

I AM THE SUM OF MY PARTS . . . 

God has moved in my life through a number of powerful men and women of God from whom I have benefited greatly. There is nothing new under the sun, as it is said. For that reason, much of what you hear in these lectures is not unique to me. Most of it was likely gleaned from other sources. I want to be transparent about that and share my sources. In terms of biblical scholarship, I have been blessed by the work of Harold Hunter (my father), Craig Keener, David Allen, Malcom Yarnell, Tom Schriner, Johnathan Pritchett (with whom I co-host Trinity Radio), F.F. Bruce, Adam Harwood (with whom I have co-authored), Steve Gregg (with whom I have worked), and Bruce Ware.

As for Christian apologetics, William Lane Craig (with whom I have lectured), Michael Licona (a personal friend), Gary Habermas, Norman Geisler, J.P. Moreland, William Dembski, Michael J. Murray, James White, Alvin Plantinga, and a host of others have impacted my thinking.

Because I have been so impressed with the structure, organization, and delivery of his own audio commentary, I personally made request to Steve Gregg (who has served as a visiting professor for Trinity) that I might follow his model. In fact, he was delighted with the idea that I might largely follow his teaching outline.

Why then, with so much great scholarship already available, would I want to add my voice? There are three reasons. First, I can imagine no more worthy endeavor than to study and proclaim the truths of scripture. Second, though I admire greatly the men listed above, I do not agree with any of them on all things. Third, God has blessed me with a humble audience that does not listen to these other voices.

I hope that you will benefit from this passing on of knowledge.

description:

title: Jude Wasn't Confused About His Sources
description:
We need help from people like you. For free ebooks, a lot more content with Braxton and Johnathan, and full seminary level courses, visit us at Patreon.com/trinityradio and prayerfully consider if perhaps you might support what we're doing. 

Learn Casually: Braxtonhunter.com
Learn Formally: Trinitysem.edu
Jimmy Akin: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_YMdWfNX0Aw
Michael Heiser: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NLXfoRqclOg

Learn Jude with apologetic concepts in mind!

From the speaker: 

I AM THE SUM OF MY PARTS . . . 

God has moved in my life through a number of powerful men and women of God from whom I have benefited greatly. There is nothing new under the sun, as it is said. For that reason, much of what you hear in these lectures is not unique to me. Most of it was likely gleaned from other sources. I want to be transparent about that and share my sources. In terms of biblical scholarship, I have been blessed by the work of Harold Hunter (my father), Craig Keener, David Allen, Malcom Yarnell, Tom Schriner, Johnathan Pritchett (with whom I co-host Trinity Radio), F.F. Bruce, Adam Harwood (with whom I have co-authored), Steve Gregg (with whom I have worked), and Bruce Ware.

As for Christian apologetics, William Lane Craig (with whom I have lectured), Michael Licona (a personal friend), Gary Habermas, Norman Geisler, J.P. Moreland, William Dembski, Michael J. Murray, James White, Alvin Plantinga, and a host of others have impacted my thinking.

Because I have been so impressed with the structure, organization, and delivery of his own audio commentary, I personally made request to Steve Gregg (who has served as a visiting professor for Trinity) that I might follow his model. In fact, he was delighted with the idea that I might largely follow his teaching outline.

Why then, with so much great scholarship already available, would I want to add my voice? There are three reasons. First, I can imagine no more worthy endeavor than to study and proclaim the truths of scripture. Second, though I admire greatly the men listed above, I do not agree with any of them on all things. Third, God has blessed me with a humble audience that does not listen to these other voices.

I hope that you will benefit from this passing on of knowledge.

title: Richard Dawkins & Co. SING!
CAUGHT ON FILM: Spontaneous Worship
What Will Catholicism Cost Cameron?
description:
The host of one of the most popular philosophy of religion YouTube channels, @CapturingChristianity, has been investigating the claims of Catholic thinkers to see if they hold up. Cameron Bertuzzi has been a close friend, and that will be obvious from the video, but as he becomes more outspoken about the positive case for Catholicism, I suggested we talk about what it will mean for him (practically speaking) in life. If he becomes Catholic, how will his family react? If he doesn't, what WILL he affirm, and how will that impact his ministry going forward? Will Catholics offer Cameron a book deal to tell his story of searching through the evidence, and to what extent do opportunities like that influence his evaluation. Alternatively, as a protestant, he may miss out on benefits he thinks Catholicism offers. We'll cover all of this in this episode. 

CAMERON'S CHANNEL: https://www.youtube.com/c/CapturingChristianity
Pints w/ Aquinas: https://www.youtube.com/c/PintsWithAquinas
Gavin Ortland: https://www.youtube.com/c/TruthUnites

title: 3 Views on Hell & Jude's "Eternal Fire"
description:
Jude 7 mentions ‚Äúeternal fire,‚Äù in the context of judgement. This language likely provokes in you, thoughts of the future state of unbelievers, and what you understand about the nature of hell. In order to provide more information to those enjoying this series through Jude‚Äôs text, I‚Äôve invited my friend, and Trinity Professor, Chris Date. Chris is the primary spokesperson for an organization called ‚ÄúReThinking Hell,‚Äù that focuses on this important doctrine. In this video, Chris will walk us through the ways advocates for three different Christian perspectives on hell might understand verse seven of Jude. 

Chris Date's books: https://www.amazon.com/Christopher-M.-Date/e/B01MS4LBGA

ReThinking Hell: https://www.youtube.com/user/rethinkinghell

title: JUSTICE CULTURE: A Message to Christians
description:
As a concept, "justice" is the theme of Western culture, at present. What justice looks like for various groups, and with regard to varying injustices, is debated. This PUBLIC MESSAGE to Christians is not intended to speak to all the specific ways injustice should be resolved in the present socio/cultural climate. Rather, it is meant to be a call to clearly illustrate the theological hope of future justice that those who long for it may not despair as others who have no hope. 

This was originally a session for the ReThinking Hell conference from 2021.

title: Deconstructing Faith Over This is Silly
description:
Whether or not there is a conflict between science and faith is the subject of a mountain of YouTube content. For many who have deconstructed, what was taken to be scientific evidence against God's existence (or a lack of scientific evidence in favor of God's existence), was a major motivator for abandoning religious positions. Yet, there are many Christians who are also working scientists who do not share these concerns. What's going on, and what should reasonable people conclude?

In terms of biblical scholarship, I have been blessed by the work of Harold Hunter (my father), Craig Keener, David Allen, Malcom Yarnell, Tom Schriner, Johnathan Pritchett (with whom I co-host Trinity Radio), F.F. Bruce, Adam Harwood (with whom I have co-authored), Steve Gregg (with whom I have worked), and Bruce Ware.

As for Christian apologetics, William Lane Craig (with whom I have lectured), Michael Licona (a personal friend), Gary Habermas, Norman Geisler, J.P. Moreland, William Dembski, Michael J. Murray, James White, Alvin Plantinga, and a host of others have impacted my thinking.

Because I have been so impressed with the structure, organization, and delivery of his own audio commentary, I personally made request to Steve Gregg (who has served as a visiting professor for Trinity) that I might follow his model. In fact, he was delighted with the idea that I might largely follow his teaching outline.

Why then, with so much great scholarship already available, would I want to add my voice? There are three reasons. First, I can imagine no more worthy endeavor than to study and proclaim the truths of scripture. Second, though I admire greatly the men listed above, I do not agree with any of them on all things. Third, God has blessed me with a humble audience that does not listen to these other voices.

I hope that you will benefit from this passing on of knowledge.

title: Calvinism, Naturalism, & Molinism on Free Will
description:
Have you ever wondered how different kinds of Christians think about free will? How does it differ from the way naturalists describe human freedom? What impact does this have for God's nature and even his own existence? In this video, Braxton lays out the various views, and explains why he thinks it makes sense to hold to the particular view he affirms. 

NOTE: I used the word "comprise" during our discussion of the Trinity. I want to be clear that I do not affirm that God is made up of parts.

A MESSAGE FROM THE ONE LIFE NETWORK:
At our local place of worship (One Life Church), we‚Äôve always dreamed of providing an environment for people who have questions about belief in God and all the goes along with it. We want to provide a place where you can ask questions or just listen to intelligent discussions about these types of conversations.

We do this through something we call One Life Explorer Edition. It‚Äôs a Sunday time we set aside once a month for people who want to explore and are open-minded but want to hear some good reasons why they should believe any of these types of things.

The subject of this conversation is consciousness. How your self-perceptions of the world can point somewhere higher and bigger than ourselves. It also brings up other topics like the existence of the soul, life after death, or even artificial intelligence. 
We want to aid you in your exploration.

Speaker: Dr. Braxton Hunter.

Visit our website: onelifechurch.org/exploreredition to submit a question for our Q&A that will happen on the One Life Podcast, or text one in at 812-643-4377

title: No, Calvinists Do Not Have a Higher View of Sovereignty
description:
Our Second Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoKB...

Learn Casually: TrinityRadio.org
Learn Formally: TrinitySem.edu

Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TrinityRadio‚Äã‚Äã

I AM THE SUM OF MY PARTS . . . 

God has moved in my life through a number of powerful men of God from whom I have benefited greatly. There is nothing new under the sun, as it is said. For that reason, much of what you hear in these lectures is not unique to me. Most of it was likely gleaned from other sources. I want to be transparent about that and share my sources. In terms of biblical scholarship, I have been blessed by the work of Harold Hunter (my father), Craig Keener, David Allen, Malcom Yarnell, Tom Schriner, Johnathan Pritchett (with whom I co-host Trinity Radio), F.F. Bruce, Adam Harwood (with whom I have co-authored), Steve Gregg (with whom I have worked), and Bruce Ware.

As for Christian apologetics, William Lane Craig (with whom I have lectured), Michael Licona (a personal friend), Gary Habermas, Norman Geisler, J.P. Moreland, William Dembski, Michael J. Murray, James White, Matt Slick, Alvin Plantinga, and a host of others have impacted my thinking.

Because I have been so impressed with the structure, organization, and delivery of his own audio commentary, I personally made request to Steve Gregg (who has served as a visiting professor for Trinity) that I might follow his model. In fact, he was delighted with the idea that I might largely follow his teaching outline.

Why then, with so much great scholarship already available, would I want to add my voice? There are three reasons. First, I can imagine no more worthy endeavour than to study and proclaim the truths of scripture. Second, though I admire greatly the men listed above, I do not agree with any of them on all things. Third, God has blessed me with a humble audience that does not listen to these other voices.

I hope that you will benefit from this passing on of knowledge.

title: When Dreams Actually Mean Something (Gen 40 & 41)
description:
I AM THE SUM OF MY PARTS . . . 

God has moved in my life through a number of powerful men of God from whom I have benefited greatly. There is nothing new under the sun, as it is said. For that reason, much of what you hear in these lectures is not unique to me. Most of it was likely gleaned from other sources. I want to be transparent about that and share my sources. In terms of biblical scholarship, I have been blessed by the work of Harold Hunter (my father), Craig Keener, David Allen, Malcom Yarnell, Tom Schriner, Johnathan Pritchett (with whom I co-host Trinity Radio), F.F. Bruce, Adam Harwood (with whom I have co-authored), Steve Gregg (with whom I have worked), and Bruce Ware.

As for Christian apologetics, William Lane Craig (with whom I have lectured), Michael Licona (a personal friend), Gary Habermas, Norman Geisler, J.P. Moreland, William Dembski, Michael J. Murray, James White, Matt Slick, Alvin Plantinga, and a host of others have impacted my thinking.

Because I have been so impressed with the structure, organization, and delivery of his own audio commentary, I personally made request to Steve Gregg (who has served as a visiting professor for Trinity) that I might follow his model. In fact, he was delighted with the idea that I might largely follow his teaching outline.

Why then, with so much great scholarship already available, would I want to add my voice? There are three reasons. First, I can imagine no more worthy endeavour than to study and proclaim the truths of scripture. Second, though I admire greatly the men listed above, I do not agree with any of them on all things. Third, God has blessed me with a humble audience that does not listen to these other voices.

I hope that you will benefit from this passing on of knowledge.

title: Genetically Modified Skeptic On Christian College Sex: A Christian Response
description:
I believe that Genetically Modified Skeptic presents this material because he wants the best for individuals struggling with sexual frustrations of various kinds that he sees as springing from Christian attitudes about sex outside of marriage. His motivations, I think, are honest and caring. However, his video, in my opinion is one-sided. It presents possible dangers related to Christian views about the topic, to the exclusion of possible dangers related to secular views. It also overly simplifies the question of sex as a "need." Further, viewers may not understand why I suggest that much of what Drew says presumes the falsity of Christianity. If Christianity is true, then as one of my patrons put it, "If extreme unwavering self-hatred is occurring after a sexual failure and repentance, what needs to change is one's beliefs about God's forgiveness, mercy, patience, and the height and depth of his love, not one's belief about whether certain types of sexual behavior are right or wrong." If Christianity is true, spiritual healthiness is an extremely important part of the human experience. God knows far more about what is physically, psychologically, and spiritually healthy than anyone. 

Original Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CU-zJCvhz4I

Articles:
Psychology Today Article: https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/hero/201603/is-porn-good-us-or-bad-us
Article from The Journal of Sex Research: https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/00224499.2013.772088
Article from The Open Journal of Preventative Medicine: https://www.researchgate.net/publication/269795335_Sexually_Risky_Behavior_in_College-Aged_Students

title: Rhett & Link: Their Evolving Approach to Jesus
description:
Last year Rhett & Link made their deconstruction and deconversion from Christianity public on their podcast, Ear Biscuits. I made a reaction video in response (linked below). In December, they discussed their current positions, how they relate to Christmas, and (I think) by extension, how they relate to life in general. Rhett & Link raise issues that I think are extremely helpful in evaluating Christianity. 

Rhett & Link's Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-GrhGWY1pnY
My Video Response from Last Year: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JC9fHrLHBfM

title: Stop Overreacting - Also - Stop Underreacting (Genesis Series Ch 34)
description:
Learn the book of Genesis with apologetic concepts in mind. 

From the speaker: 

I AM THE SUM OF MY PARTS . . . 

God has moved in my life through a number of powerful men of God from whom I have benefited greatly. There is nothing new under the sun, as it is said. For that reason, much of what you hear in these lectures is not unique to me. Most of it was likely gleaned from other sources. I want to be transparent about that and share my sources. In terms of biblical scholarship, I have been blessed by the work of Harold Hunter (my father), Craig Keener, David Allen, Malcom Yarnell, Tom Schriner, Johnathan Pritchett (with whom I co-host Trinity Radio), F.F. Bruce, Adam Harwood (with whom I have co-authored), Steve Gregg (with whom I have worked), and Bruce Ware.

As for Christian apologetics, William Lane Craig (with whom I have lectured), Michael Licona (a personal friend), Gary Habermas, Norman Geisler, J.P. Moreland, William Dembski, Michael J. Murray, James White, Matt Slick, Alvin Plantinga, and a host of others have impacted my thinking.

Because I have been so impressed with the structure, organization, and delivery of his own audio commentary, I personally made request to Steve Gregg (who has served as a visiting professor for Trinity) that I might follow his model. In fact, he was delighted with the idea that I might largely follow his teaching outline.

Why then, with so much great scholarship already available, would I want to add my voice? There are three reasons. First, I can imagine no more worthy endeavor than to study and proclaim the truths of scripture. Second, though I admire greatly the men listed above, I do not agree with any of them on all things. Third, God has blessed me with a humble audience that does not listen to these other voices.

I hope that you will benefit from this passing on of knowledge.

title: Pinecreek Answered With Scripture
description:
When Jesus was confronted by the temptations of the devil, he responded with scripture. I do not believe I would deny Christ for worldly gain or the influences of my family or friends. I certainly hope I wouldn't. However, if I ever did it would only speak to my weakness. It would not speak to the truth or beauty of the gospel. As I've said many times, my faith is falsifiable in principle, and if one were to falsify it, I would be forced by integrity to accept that. Yet, breaking my loyalty to Christ will never come, I pray, because of the influences described by Doug. Further, since I have examined the criticisms of my faith and found them insufficient, I confidently add that I cannot imagine ever rejecting my Savior.

She makes clear in the original video that she doesn‚Äôt use that approach, and sees merit in what we‚Äôre saying, but then provides what she imagines one might say to the challenge. We were responding to THAT. Johnathan, who had not seen the entire original video said she was wrong. There are certainly problems with the justification she imagines some atheists might make, but that doesn‚Äôt mean SHE is wrong. We apologize if, in any way her position was unclear, and encourage viewers to watch her response video linked in the description.

title: What Jordan Peterson Gets Right & Wrong About Belief in God
description:
Jordan Peterson is just beginning to make his way back into the public eye after a long period of severe health problems, and I recently read his book "12 Rules for Life." I‚Äôve watched much of his series on the psychological value of the Bible, and have ingested most of his debates. Many Christians don‚Äôt quite know how to feel about Peterson. He‚Äôs clearly friendly to the faith, much like Benjamin Franklin was, but hesitates at important moments. Principally he has often said he doesn‚Äôt like the question of whether he believes in God. This has frustrated many listeners. In this video, we‚Äôre going to take a look at some of his comments about belief in God, and analyze some problematic perspectives he holds that get echoed in the church. We‚Äôll also see one valuable benefit Peterson has to offer.

title: The Right Time to Give Up (Genesis Series Ch 32 & 33)
description:
Learn the book of Genesis with apologetic concepts in mind. 

From the speaker: 

I AM THE SUM OF MY PARTS . . . 

God has moved in my life through a number of powerful men of God from whom I have benefited greatly. There is nothing new under the sun, as it is said. For that reason, much of what you hear in these lectures is not unique to me. Most of it was likely gleaned from other sources. I want to be transparent about that and share my sources. In terms of biblical scholarship, I have been blessed by the work of Harold Hunter (my father), Craig Keener, David Allen, Malcom Yarnell, Tom Schriner, Johnathan Pritchett (with whom I co-host Trinity Radio), F.F. Bruce, Adam Harwood (with whom I have co-authored), Steve Gregg (with whom I have worked), and Bruce Ware.

As for Christian apologetics, William Lane Craig (with whom I have lectured), Michael Licona (a personal friend), Gary Habermas, Norman Geisler, J.P. Moreland, William Dembski, Michael J. Murray, James White, Matt Slick, Alvin Plantinga, and a host of others have impacted my thinking.

Because I have been so impressed with the structure, organization, and delivery of his own audio commentary, I personally made request to Steve Gregg (who has served as a visiting professor for Trinity) that I might follow his model. In fact, he was delighted with the idea that I might largely follow his teaching outline.

Why then, with so much great scholarship already available, would I want to add my voice? There are three reasons. First, I can imagine no more worthy endeavor than to study and proclaim the truths of scripture. Second, though I admire greatly the men listed above, I do not agree with any of them on all things. Third, God has blessed me with a humble audience that does not listen to these other voices.

I hope that you will benefit from this passing on of knowledge.

title: Determinism Refuted Theologically
description:
Drs. Leighton Flowers, Tim Stratton and Braxton Hunter (Team USA) come together to refute the French Calvinistic philosopher, Guillaume Bignon's most recent broadcast on the Revealed Apologetic broadcast hosted by Ely Ayala, in which Bignon brings arguments against Flowers, Hunter and Stratton's libertarian perspectives, as seen here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rP2BW...

Bignon affirms "Theistic Determinism," the audacious belief that God causally determines all things, including all your choices, desires and actions; but yet, mysteriously we are still morally accountable for those choices, desires and actions (ie "Calvinistic Compatibilism").

The plan is to divide our response into three parts:

Part 1: Determinism refuted Biblically (Host by Dr. Flowers at Soteriology 101)

Part 2: Determinism refuted Theologically (Hosted by Dr. Hunter at Trinity Radio)

Part 3: Determinism refuted Philosophically (Hosted by Dr. Stratton at Free Thinking Ministries) 

[links to be provided once completed]

title: Seminary Professors Respond to Questions from Atheist Hemant Mehta
description:
If your child were dying, and I hope that never happens, would just pray for them or would you take them to a doctor? And if you'd do both, which one do you think has more of an impact?

Whose prayers does God answer? And if it's ultimately His Will, why bother praying?

If you have cancer, what would help you more: Certain drugs, or prayer? 

If you had an amputated limb, would prayer ever bring it back? 

If you have an exam coming up, what would contribute more to a higher score: Prayer or more studying? 

If you prayed for me over YouTube right now, do you think I would know it?

What matters to God more: The quantity of people praying or the quality of their prayers? If quantity matters, shouldn't the most popular team always win the Super Bowl? If quality matters, why do people you love sometimes die no matter what you do? 

Is it possible that your prayers have no supernatural effect and only serve to make you feel better?

Would you ever admit it if that were true?

Is there anything in your life that makes you doubt God's existence? 

How would your life change if you had serious doubts about God's existence?

Was Jesus white?

Why does God seem more likely to answer the prayers of a talented athlete than a starving child overseas?

Why does God Seem to hate Africa?

If a group of Africans swooped in to your community with the intention of converting you and your neighbors to their tribal faith, what would your reaction be?

Does God speak to you? 

If God spoke to you and told you to kill someone, would you do it?

Is God always watching you? How about when you're on the toilet?

How do you respond when someone who's not a Christian tells you about their religious faith? Do you listen and consider what they have to say or do you just ignore them because they don't believe what you believe?

What do you make of Muslims who think the Koran is the true holy book? Are they wrong? Have you read the Koran? Why do you dismiss them so easily?

Original Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SI-_FJuTPns

title: Matt Dillahunty vs Dinesh D'Souza: Debate Review
description:
In the late 2000s Dinesh D'Souza was one of the most aggressive and enjoyable debaters in the apologetics world. His style and method were different. His speaking ability was excellent. This was important since his most common debating partner was the late Christopher Hitchens. After a lengthy hiatus from the atheist/theist debates, D'Souza returned to the stage to have a discussion with Matt Dillahunty. Yet, it would be hard to argue that Dinesh got the better end of the event. In this video, I'll explain what I think both debaters got right, what they got wrong, and why Matt Dillahunty beat Dinesh D'Souza.

title: PineCreek on Johnathan Pritchett!
Chris Date (of ReThinking Hell) And Johnathan respond to atheist, PineCreek on Hell
description:
At the recent Rethinking Hell conference, Johnathan Pritchett delivered a presentation titled, "Hell, the Gospel, and Sitting on the Fence" (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dg7AePz-AP4). Shortly after his presentation was published, YouTube atheist PineCreek published a nearly two-hour review of Pritchett's presentation titled, "Hell is for Christians... not for Unbelievers" (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NTxSgAEVZ6g).

In this episode of Trinity Radio, Pritchett is joined by Chris Date from Rethinking Hell to respond to some of PineCreek's comments. Among other things, they discuss the relevance of the topic of hell to non-Christians, the reason for treating some doctrines as definitional of Christianity and others as secondary and negotiable, and why hell is by no means the only reason for believing in Christ.

In his presentation, Pritchett explained why he's comfortable remaining undecided between the following two Christian views of hell:

Traditional view - Those who do not trust in Christ for salvation will live in hell forever, in immortal resurrection bodies, in some sort of torment.

Conditional immortality (Chris Date's view) - Those who do not trust in Christ for salvation will be raised, judged, and executed (capital punishment), never to live or experience anything ever again.

title: Christopher Hitchens: A Christian Response to His Most Popular Statements
description:
It is with great reverence that I respond to the late great anti-theist, Christopher Hitchens. There is much to commend about the man, even from a Christian perspective. Naturally, there is much that he said to which believers may object. In this video, I deconstruct his typical case against theism with an eye toward charity. I recognize that though he likely would not have responded to a youtube video, at least in life he could have. He cannot respond now, and I admit that this is a bit unfair. Nevertheless, I believe he would approve of the endeavor. It is out of respect for the man that I take his ideas seriously, and criticize them straightforwardly.

title: The Kalam Doesn't Mention God: A Response to Rationality Rules
description:
The Kalam Cosmological Argument is consider by many to be one of the best arguments for God's existence. However, it's common for skeptics to point out that it doesn't mention God, and so it can't be an argument for God. Stephen Woodford's (Rationality Rules) video which claims to debunk the Kalam cosmological argument has been passed around in the atheist community quite a bit. Capturing Christianity's Cameron Bertuzzi responded, and Woodford wasted little time in firing back. In this video we'll take a look at Rationality Rules' dominant defense of his video, and answer the question: should apologists ditch the Kalam since it doesn't mention God?

Atheist YouTuber, PineCreek, recently made a video referencing me (Braxton) entitled, "Top 20 things Christians (especially apologists) have trouble admitting." In this video, Johnathan Pritchett (with occasional comments from me) responds! How much will he admit?

Original Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c43ttnTZr6I

title: Bart Ehrman's Case Against the Resurrection: A Christian Response
description:
"It depends which gospel you read!" These words are familiar to anyone who has listened to renowned scholar and debater, Bart Ehrman. In general, Ehrman is a powerful scholar, but he misses it when it comes to the resurrection of Jesus. In this video, we'll walk through his case against the central Christian historical event, and show what may be the weaknesses of his approach. 

Video to which I‚Äôm responding: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GHJE7cetkB4
My Resurrection Case (in the Dillahunty debate): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y9Uktg9nLx8

Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/TrinityRadio

title: Aron Ra, Inspiring Philosophy, Trent Dougherty, GMS and PineCreek: Two Christians React
description:
Aron Ra is well known in internet atheist circles. Recently, he debated Michael Jones, and Trent Dougherty in the same week. We thought it was worth discussing, specifically how Ra views the concept of faith. Listen as we ramble and meander through all the related and unrelated issues.

title: Paulogia & The Masters of the Universe: A Response
description:
Paulogia is a pretty popular atheist youtuber. He tackles some of the more prominent theistic arguments. In this episode, I respond to his criticism of the Kalam Cosmological Argument. We'll cover all the typical objections INCLUDING a discussion of the nature of time, and whether the "B-theory" undermines the Kalam argument.

Original Video: https://youtu.be/nKSn32QmurQ

Learn formally: Trinitysem.edu
Learn Casually: BraxtonHunter.com

title: The Chris Date Interview
description:
Is hell eternal conscious torment, or the end of consciousness (like some may imagine the death penalty)?Chris Date is the president of Rethinking Hell - a ministry focused on the defense of a view regarding the nature of hell known as Conditionalism. In this episode we talk with Chris about the various views available to evangelicals, and hear about an upcoming conference devoted to the subject.

Visit Rethinking Hell at: rethinkinghell.com/

title: Sam Harris is Confused
description:
Sam Harris was once asked, "Is there a possibility of a Creator?" Instead of answering directly he meandered through a confused monologue about Islam and Christianity before spilling over into a confused musing about those who never hear the message of a particular religion. He managed to mix in a comment or two about the matrix, and the possibility that we're all in a virtual simulation.

Learn Formally: TrinitySem.edu
Learn Casually: BraxtonHunter.com

title: (Part Two) Genetically Modified Skeptic: Is Atheism Worth it?
description:
In a twist on Pascal's Wager, Genetically Modified Skeptic lists what he thinks one stands to lose if they become religious. Johnathan Pritchett and I stroll through that list to find out whether we've wagered poorly!

For more on Pascal's Wager, check out this podcast from our friend Cameron Bertuzzi over at Capturing Christianity: https://soundcloud.com/capturingchristianity/cc012-is-pascals-wager-sound-with-dr-michael-rota-part-1

She lists a number of other items that she presumably thinks Christians would agree would be ridiculous to consider evidence for God. Except . . . some of them would.

title: S10E6: How Does NASA Help Explain the Resurrection?
description:
Who did Jesus think he was? It makes a difference when it comes to the discussion of the resurrection. We discuss what Braxton calls "recalibrated plausibility," and answer the question of whether there is good reason to believe that Jesus thought of himself as God's special agent to bring about the kingdom. How does this relate to NASA and the moon landing? Find out on this episode of Trinity Radio!

title: S10E5: YouTube Comments from the Matt Dillahunty Debate
description:
In this episode we discuss some of the harsh responses we've received from atheists in the comment stream of the Matt Dillahunty vs. Braxton Hunter debate. We also try to answer some of the more kind-hearted and thoughtful questions from reasonable atheist commenters. 

NOTE: It was pointed out to me that at the about the 6:00 mark I actually did, unintentionally, mischaracterize Matt's claim. I said that he claimed because Christians disagree, "Therefore Christianity is false." That's actually not quite what he said. I can only suppose he was trying to say something along the lines that this discredits the Christian claims. My comments on this from the debate still stand, but I appreciate the correction, and wanted to make it known.

Learn Casually: BraxtonHunter.com

title: Snippet of a debate between Johnathan & Braxton
description:
From the Patreon only bonus episode, this is a short snippet of a much lengthier casual (though blunt) debate about several different issues. It happened organically, but you've been asking for it for months! Become a patron at patreon.com/trinityradio to hear the whole thing when it is released in a few days. 

Patreon.com/trinityradio
Learn casually: Braxtonhunter.com
Learn formally: Trinitysem.edu

title: S8E22: Season Eight Finale
description:
American flags in church? In the season eight finale we begin the new occasional series, "The Finders!" In it, we answer questions from listeners about patriotic services, angels, Paul's use of Old Testament passages, free will, Calvinism, prophecy, and hell. AND, we consider what the YI'MA series of season eight has taught us about apologetics, evangelism, and opposing worldviews. 

Learn Formally: Trinitysem.edu
Learn Casually: BraxtonHunter.com

Music by: David Cutter Music - www.davidcuttermusic.co.uk

title: S8E21: Response to "Why I'm a Jehovah's Witness" (YI'MA)
description:
We respond to an individual who explains why he/she is a Jehovah's Witness, and give a bit of history as well as doctrinal perspective. In addition to this, we discuss physicalism, armageddon, annihilationism, date-setters, and whether or not Pascal's Wager is worth anything. 

Video to which we're responding: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GPoEx9ko3TY

Learn Formally: Trinitysem.edu
Learn Casually: BraxtonHunter.com

title: S8E20: Why I'm a Christian Apologist (YI'MA)
description: After multiple episodes responding to various opposing worldviews, we tackle the question of why we (Braxton & Johnathan) are Christian Apologists. This includes a discussion of the various apologetic methodologies, and a loud-mouthed challenge from Pritchett Prime.

title: 25. Genesis 28 (Full Chapter)
description:
Learn the book of Genesis with apologetic concepts in mind. 

From the speaker: 

I AM THE SUM OF MY PARTS . . . 

God has moved in my life through a number of powerful men of God from whom I have benefited greatly. There is nothing new under the sun, as it is said. For that reason, much of what you hear in these lectures is not unique to me. Most of it was likely gleaned from other sources. I want to be transparent about that and share my sources. In terms of biblical scholarship, I have been blessed by the work of Harold Hunter (my father), Craig Keener, David Allen, Malcom Yarnell, Tom Schriner, Johnathan Pritchett (with whom I co-host Trinity Radio), F.F. Bruce, Adam Harwood (with whom I have co-authored), Steve Gregg (with whom I have worked), and Bruce Ware.

As for Christian apologetics, William Lane Craig (with whom I have lectured), Michael Licona (a personal friend), Gary Habermas, Norman Geisler, J.P. Moreland, William Dembski, Michael J. Murray, James White, Matt Slick, Alvin Plantinga, and a host of others have impacted my thinking.

Because I have been so impressed with the structure, organization, and delivery of his own audio commentary, I personally made request to Steve Gregg (who has served as a visiting professor for Trinity) that I might follow his model. In fact, he was delighted with the idea that I might largely follow his teaching outline.

Why then, with so much great scholarship already available, would I want to add my voice? There are three reasons. First, I can imagine no more worthy endeavor than to study and proclaim the truths of scripture. Second, though I admire greatly the men listed above, I do not agree with any of them on all things. Third, God has blessed me with a humble audience that does not listen to these other voices.

I hope that you will benefit from this passing on of knowledge.

title: S8E19: Questions and Answers With Listeners
description:
Evangelizing Mormons, and Jehovah Witnesses, Talking Serpents, Law and Gospel, Sex, and a number of other issues are covered in this Q&A special. It's also our way of launching a new mini episode series called, "The Finders" because we believe that while you may not be prepared to be an answer giver, you can already be an answer finder for skeptics. 

Learn Formally: Trinitysem.edu
Learn Casually: BraxtonHunter.com

Music by: David Cutter Music - www.davidcuttermusic.co.uk

title: S8E18: Response to "Why I'm an Anti-Calvinist" (YI'MA)
description:
Leighton Flowers, the evangelist, apologist, discipler, Christian leader, and sometimes soteriology commenter, joins us to discuss the common claims that he is a divisive, angry, one-string-banjo with a chip on his shoulder about Calvinism.

Leighton's blog: Soteriology101.com

Learn Formally: Trinitysem.edu
Learn Casually: BraxtonHunter.com

Music by: David Cutter Music - www.davidcuttermusic.co.uk

title: S8E17: Response to "Why I'm a Muslim" (YI'MA)
description:
We respond to two videos, and a Huffington Post article in which individuals explain why they are Muslim. The episode begins with a historical discussion of Islam, and concludes with a brief analysis of Muhammad's character and claims, the Quran's claims to be without contradiction, and the nature of Allah.

Huffington Article:
https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/a-leap-of-faiths-why-i-became-a-muslim-in-2017_us_593afb6ce4b014ae8c69e037

description:
In this episode we discuss a life-changing moment in the life of Dr. Johnathan Pritchett. Does our experience of God count as evidence for the truth of Christianity? Find out in this week's episode.

Learn Casually: BraxtonHunter.com

title: S8E14: Response to Why I'm a Pro-choice Christian (YI'MA)
description:
Actually, the person to which we are responding claims to be pro-life, but thinks abortion should be legal. We think this actually makes her pro-choice, but anyway . . . this is not the same episode on abortion we've done so many times before.

title: S8E13: Response to Why I'm a Scientologist (YI'MA)
description:
You already know that Scientology is super weird, but do you understand the underlying philosophical principles? Do you know what scientologists say about Jesus? Check out this week's episode and hear what you haven't heard before about this strange group.

Article to which we're responding:https://www.standleague.org/blog/why-am-i-a-scientologist.html

title: S8E12: Calvinism: Why Won't the Debate End?
description:
Dr. Pritchett stands in the corner, and . . . A frustrating pattern has emerged. Every time we do an episode related to Calvinism, it instantly becomes one of our most listened to. We find this annoying. In this episode we discuss why the debate is so intriguing.

Black Magic Calvinism Video: https://youtu.be/7EML15pn0a8

description:

title: The Acceptable Obsession
description: The Acceptable Obsession, is a personal testimony regarding the importance of studying the Word of God! How is it even possible that a man could go from being a youth pastor, to a senior pastor, to an apologist without knowing the Bible to as great a depth as he should? This speaks to a major problem in the church today, and we hope you'll listen with an open heart, allowing the Spirit to convict you of your personal need to go deeper!

title: S8E9: Response to "Why I'm a Mormon" (YI'MA)
description:
Is Mormonism the restoration of the church of Jesus Christ? Did Jesus appear, bodily, to the Native Americans? Do you have a home in the Telestial Kingdom? And what does Battle Star Gallactica have to do with all of this? We'll cover these questions and more on this week's episode of Trinity Radio, as we respond to a successful YouTuber who explains why he's a Mormon. 

This is part of our YI'MA series, in which we respond to adherents of various worldviews who explain "Why I'm A" whatever. Check out the rest of the YI'MA videos on our YouTube channel!

title: S8E7: What's Up With Hell? Part Two
description:
In the second episode on the nature of hell, we discuss the views of Conditional Immortality (annihilationism), and Evangelical Universalism. We also provide advice on preaching hell in an evangelistic setting. And Braxton and Johnathan say goodbye to a beloved Trinity Radio personality.
