Learn Casually: BraxtonHunter.com

Music by: David Cutter Music - www.davidcuttermusic.co.uk

title: Braxton Hunter vs Daniel Alvarez "Is There Evidence for the Existence of God?"
description: This debate was Braxton's first live, public, moderated debate, and he only had ONE DAY to prepare. It was held in October of 2010 in Miami, Fl. Daniel Alvarez is the professor of world religions at Florida International University (FIU). He is a Harvard graduate and is a regular commentator on various news outlets.

title: Braxton Hunter & Leighton Flowers vs Tyler Vela & Sean Cole "The Unconditional Election Debate"
description: This moderated online debate was held in May of 2016. Tyler Vela is an apologist and podcaster. Sean Cole is a pastor and professor. Leighton Flowers, Braxton's partner in this debate, is a podcaster and professor.Toward the end of the debate Tyler's audio was not recorded. This makes it sound like Braxton and Leighton are responding to no one. This was a problem with the audio as it was provided by the event coordinators and is the same wherever this debate is available.

title: Braxton Hunter & Leighton Flowers vs Tyler Vela & Sean Cole "The Total Depravity Debate"
description: This moderated online debate was held in March of 2016. Tyler Vela is an apologist and podcaster. Sean Cole is a pastor and professor. Leighton Flowers, Braxton's partner in this debate, is a podcaster and professor.

title: Johnathan Pritchett & Leighton Flowers vs Sonny Hernandez & Theodore Zachariades
description:
This debate took place in Houston, TX in November of 2017.

Dr. Leighton Flowers and Dr. Johnathan Pritchett (Traditionalists) debate Dr. Sonny Hernandez and Dr. Theodore Zachariades (Calvinists) over the doctrine of Free Will. 

Things become a bit contentious in the CX when Theodore and Sonny disavow the London Baptist Confession's statement on free will (Chapter 9) since prior to the debate Leighton and Johnathan were told they affirmed it. This cause much unnecessary confusion and contention.

On July 18th, an email with all parties copied, Sonny said, "Hey Leighton, The best way to summarize our position would be to review the 1689 London Baptist Confession or the Westminster Confession of Faith (See Free will)."  And even after Leighton literally copied and pasted chapter 9 (the one on Free Will) into the email and asking specifically what they affirmed, Sonny wrote back to all parties (including Theodore), "Leighton, what you see in the confession is what we affirm..."  Leighton put up a live video on the Soteriology 101 facebook page showing all these emails for his followers to read for themselves. 

Things also became unnecessarily heated when Theodore called his opponents "brothers" and then retracted that statement saying they were merely "opponents" and that he wasn't sure they were actual "brothers" due to their view of grace.

title: Braxton Hunter & Will "The Atheist - FollowUp Discussion
description: Will is back to answer questions about atheism and why he left the faith. Braxton and Nathan try unsuccessfully to let him express himself without being challenged. Hell, certainty, Adam and Eve and everything else is discussed.

title: Braxton Hunter vs Will "The Atheist" - Does God Exist?
description: In this first episode from the "Debate Hour" collection, Braxton has a debate with Will who is an administrator of happyatheistforum.com. They discuss God as the cause and designer of the universe and whether atheism or theism is the more reasonable position.

title: Braxton Hunter vs Paul Cooper
description: This debate on the question "Is Calvinism True?" was held on June 8th, 2014 at the Whosoever Will Conference coinciding with the Southern Baptist Convention's annual meeting in Baltimore, Maryland. Paul Cooper is the senior pastor of Marshall Baptist Church in Marshall, Illinois,and is a graduate of Southern Baptist Theological Seminary. Dr. Braxton Hunter is an evangelist, Christian apologist and the Executive Vice President of Trinity College of the Bible and Theological Seminary in Newburgh, Indiana. Check out BraxtonHunter.com or Trinitysem.edu for more details.

title: Braxton Hunter vs Joe Mira "Is Calvinism True?"
description: This debate was held on Sept. 29, 2013 in Miami, Fl. The topic of the debate: "Is Calvinism True?" Joe Mira is a church planter and has taught for a SBC seminary extension in Miami. His church's website is NccMiami.com.

title: S8E6: What's Up With Hell? Part One
description:
Mark Twain said, "Go to Heaven for the climate, Hell for the company." But for those of us who take the concept of Hell seriously, there are a number of questions for which we want answers. Is Hell eternal conscious torment? If so, are the flames of Hell to be taken literally? And what is the relevant biblica data on the subject? We'll discuss all of this in the first of two episodes on the nature of Hell!

title: S8E5: Response to "Is God the Devil?" (YI'MA)
description:
We respond to a very gothic looking fellow who claims that God is more like the Devil than the Sunday School image of Gentle Jesus meek and mild. We discuss the atrocities of the Old Testament, and provide two simple principles for responding to these kinds of criticisms.

Learn Casually: BraxtonHunter.com

description:

description:

And . . . if you're tired of all the atheism episodes, next week we respond to a major world religion.

title: S8E1: Science vs Religion, and Prayer (YI'MA)
description:
In the season eight premier, Drs. Hunter and Pritchett begin a new segment called "Why I'm A . . ." in which they respond to those of opposing worldviews who have made their cases on YouTube. 

In this episode, they discuss why "Because science . . ." isn't a reasonable answer to the question of why one is an atheist. Nor is "Prayer doesn't work." We'll unpack it all on this week's Trinity Radio!

Here's the video to which we're responding: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3o2whYEi6us

Learn formally: TrinitySem.edu
Learn casually: BraxtonHunter.com

Music by: David Cutter Music -¬†www.davidcuttermusic.co.uk

title: God is the Best Explanation for Morality
description:
Is anything really right or wrong - good or bad? Most people think so. But why is it that morality exists and deep down we all seem to know it? Ultimately, if there really is right and wrong - good and bad - God must exist. Wanna know why? This video is a good start.

Learn Formally: TrinitySem.edu
Learn Casually: BraxtonHunter.com

The Moral Argument used in this video is employed frequently by William Lane Craig. 

Music credit as prescribed by the artist:
Evan Schaeffer: https://soundcloud.com/evanschaeffer

title: The Trinity Radio Christmas Special
description:
Did C.S. Lewis really say we should all be Christmas pagans in a recently rediscovered article? Did Christianity just borrow from virgin birth stories in other religions? Is there a belated Christopher Hitchens Christmas scandal? Find out in this best ever Christmas special!

Learn formally: TrinitySem.edu
Learn casually: BraxtonHunter.com

title: 4. 1 Peter 1:17-25
description: Dr. Johnathan Pritchett is a professor of biblical studies at Trinity College of the Bible and Theological Seminary. title: S7E20: The Freewill Argument Examined
description:
Do you have real freedom, or are you just a highly complex computer software program? If you've ever wanted to get a clearer understanding of the freewill controversy, we'll give it to you. In this episode, we pick apart the argument from freewill presented earlier this week in another video. 

Learn formally: TrinitySem.edu
Learn casually: BraxtonHunter.com

title: God is the Best Explanation for Free Will
description:
Most people recognize that they have the genuine ability to make free choices. Yet, on atheistic materialism no such freedom exists. The universe is just a closed system of cause and effect. Find out why God is the best explanation for the freedom of the will.

Learn more at Trinitysem.edu and BraxtonHunter.com

Music (Listed as prescribed by the creator): 

Joakim Karud http://youtube.com/joakimkarud

General terminology of the argument borrowed from William Lane Craig's argument from moral objectivity.

We discuss our individual verse by verse projects and why Braxton chose the book of Genesis. Did Moses write it? What's JEDP all about? Has Johnathan showered recently? All these questions will be answered!

Learn casually: BraxtonHunter.com

title: Evangelistic Apologetics
description:
Is it true that Christian Apologetics has nothing to do with Evangelism?

Learn more at Trinitysem.edu and BraxtonHunter.com

Music by Joakim Karud http://youtube.com/joakimkarud

title: 5. Genesis 3:1-13
description:
Learn the book of Genesis with apologetic concepts in mind. 

From the speaker: 

I AM THE SUM OF MY PARTS . . . 

God has moved in my life through a number of powerful men of God from whom I have benefited greatly. There is nothing new under the sun, as it is said. For that reason, much of what you hear in these lectures is not unique to me. Most of it was likely gleaned from other sources. I want to be transparent about that and share my sources. In terms of biblical scholarship, I have been blessed by the work of Harold Hunter (my father), Craig Keener, David Allen, Malcom Yarnell, Tom Schriner, Johnathan Pritchett (with whom I co-host Trinity Radio), F.F. Bruce, Adam Harwood (with whom I have co-authored), Steve Gregg (with whom I have worked), and Bruce Ware.

As for Christian apologetics, William Lane Craig (with whom I have lectured), Michael Licona (a personal friend), Gary Habermas, Norman Geisler, J.P. Moreland, William Dembski, Michael J. Murray, James White, Matt Slick, Alvin Plantinga, and a host of others have impacted my thinking.

Because I have been so impressed with the structure, organization, and delivery of his own audio commentary, I personally made request to Steve Gregg (who has served as a visiting professor for Trinity) that I might follow his model. In fact, he was delighted with the idea that I might largely follow his teaching outline.

Why then, with so much great scholarship already available, would I want to add my voice? There are three reasons. First, I can imagine no more worthy endeavor than to study and proclaim the truths of scripture. Second, though I admire greatly the men listed above, I do not agree with any of them on all things. Third, God has blessed me with a humble audience that does not listen to these other voices.

I hope that you will benefit from this passing on of knowledge.

title: Apologetics in Florida with Dr. Mike Licona
description:
Mike Licona is one of the leading voices on the resurrection. His new book deals with differences in the gospels. He's been a friend for several years, and we've spoken together before, but it was great to get to spend some time with him at this incredible event in beautiful Sarasota, FL. 

If you aren't familiar with Dr. Licona's work, check out his website - linked below. 

Dr. Chip Bennett is also a great friend, and a powerful theological mind. His Church (Grace Community Church) hosted the event. Check out their site too. 

Dr. Licona's Site: https://www.risenjesus.com
Mike's New Book - https://www.amazon.com/Why-Are-There-Differences-Gospels/dp/0190264268

Dr. Chip Bennett: http://www.gracesarasota.com/

My Site: BraxtonHunter.com

Couldn't a loving and all powerful God have just let the children and animals die instantly? Braxton and Johnathan tackle this issue. As a bonus, they also tackle criticisms based on the development of religion and evolution.¬†

title: God is the Best Explanation for the Design of the Universe
description:
God is the best explanation for the fine-tuning of the universe for life. Lots of people are familiar with what are commonly called "design arguments." A more technical term is teleological arguments. Teleological arguments seek to demonstrate that the complexity of the universe strongly implicates the existence of a designer. The term teleological comes from the Greek word, telos which means ‚Äúends‚Äù or ‚Äúpurpose.‚Äù What are commonly thought of as design arguments can formally be referred to as teleological arguments because the intent is to show that there is a purpose or end (goal) in the furniture of the universe. As is the case with the cosmological argument, properly articulated teleological arguments are considered to be among the most convincing cases that can be set forth in favor of theism.

In this short video, I'll lay out one such argument Christian apologists use to demonstrate God's existence. 

Learn more at Trinitysem.edu and BraxtonHunter.com

Music (Listed as prescribed by the creator): 

Joakim Karud http://youtube.com/joakimkarud

title: S7E8: Should You Do Business at Church?
description:
We discuss whether you should do business with church members, what to do about interlopers who are only there to sell you something, and how this all relates to supporting each other in the family of God. 

Don't forget to Like, Comment, and Subscribe!
Learn Formally: Trinitysem.edu
Learn Casually: BraxtonHunter.com

title: God is the Best Explanation for the Beginning of the Universe
description:
I'm often asked what I think is the best argument for the beginning of the universe. It's a personal preference, I guess, but I like to start with the idea that God is the best explanation for the beginning of the universe. God is the CAUSE! 

In apologetics circles, this is known as a cosmological argument. In this video we'll look at the kalam cosmological argument. This video is not intended to deal with all the specific objections. That will be covered in a later video. Nevertheless, beginners trying to understand what Christian philosophers (like William Lane Craig) are talking about when they use this argument, might find this summation helpful. 

Learn more at Trinitysem.edu and BraxtonHunter.com

Music (Listed as prescribed by the creator): 

Joakim Karud http://youtube.com/joakimkarud

title: Meeting A Hero: Dr. William Lane Craig
description:
In 2004 I discovered Christian apologetics and became a geek for it. At first, I thought it all amounted to the young earth creationist crusade against evolution. It wasn't long before I discovered Norman Geisler, Gary Habermas, and William Lane Craig. For years I tried to read everything he ever wrote, listen to every debate, and faithfully download his podcasts (Reasonable Faith & Defenders). As a young apologist, it was my dream that one day I'd speak alongside Dr. Craig at a conference somewhere . . . 

Learn more at Trinitysem.edu and BraxtonHunter.com

Follow William Lane Craig's ministry at ReasonableFaith.org
